content: Try right+click on the folder and pick properties > repair.
creator: wsmwk

content: Thanks for that. Unfortunately, Thunderbird freezes, so I can't use the repair tool… I've now tried deleting the msf files and watched it rebuild the file, but as soon as I enter the password for one account, it freezes again. I have one account for which I manually enter the password. Thunderbird opens and sits at that entry box, and I can see t updating and hear it download new messages from other accounts, but it remains locked to that password entry screen. As soon as I enter the password, it starts the spinning disk and stops responding.
creator: james.d.gifford

content: What does the "Error Console" say? Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console or ⬆︎⌘ J
creator: Mapenzi

content:

content:
james.d.gifford said
I have one account for which I manually enter the password. Thunderbird opens and sits at that entry box, and I can see t updating and hear it download new messages from other accounts, but it remains locked to that password entry screen.

Can you close the password entry box before TB freezes? So that you may use the menus such as "Tools"?
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Just tried. When I close the window, I can get the dropdown menu to open, but then it freezes… (Force Quit shows it as "(not responding)").

I've deleted the .msf files to get it to rebuild in case that was the problem (for imap accounts), and let it run overnight without entering the password to that one POP account, and it rebuilds them just fine, and I can hear the chime as new messages are coming in for those other accounts. But then it hangs when I do anything to close the password entry or enter the password for the problem POP account.

It makes me suspect the problem is with that one account, and I wonder if I can delete it from the Profile/##name##/Mail/ folder or something like that. I can recover the information from that account, and I have it all backed up, so I really just need to figure out why it freezes.
creator: james.d.gifford

content:
james.d.gifford said
Unfortunately, I can't access the Tools menu. It only shows the dropdown "Thunderbird" menu after start up (it locks me into "Enter your password for …", and once I enter it (or don't by entering "cancel") it freezes. Here's the Error Report it sends to Thunderbird:

Once again: can you close the "Enter password box" before TB freezes? The report you cited is very different from the contents of the "Error Console". Please try again but this time don't enter the password but just close the box. If TB stays alive you might get to Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console ...?
creator: Mapenzi

content:
james.d.gifford said
It makes me suspect the problem is with that one account, and I wonder if I can delete it from the Profile/##name##/Mail/ folder or something like that. I can recover the information from that account, and I have it all backed up, so I really just need to figure out why it freezes.

Yes, delete the problematic POP account, at least temporarily, but don't fiddle around in the profile folder! Go to Account Settings > problematic account > Delete (see image) When the "Remove account and data" box opens, don't check "remove message data" This way your account information will be removed but TB will conserve your message data! (see image)

content:
I am not familiar with the Owl for Exchange add-on. Also in your error console report I've seen that you use some add-ons I never tested.

I asked you to test TB in a new, virgin profile in the first place to know whether your problem lies in the profile or if it may be caused by a new bug. A new profile doesn't modify your message data in the actuel profile, it is completely independent of the actual profile. If TB runs in the new profile without slowness or freezing we know that the unknown cause of must be in your old profile, and you should continue testing by creating one or more of your usual email accounts (pop & imap)
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Sorry, I phrased that poorly. I created a new profile, and that works fine and TB is functioning normally. (I had to use Owl to access the email account I used to set up the new profile).

So the issue is in my old profile.
creator: james.d.gifford

content: Now, with a new profile running smoothly, you'll have to transfer certain data from the old to the new profile. If you have IMAP accounts set them up again with your existing email addresses, they will immediately synchronised with the servers. If you used the POP protocol for other email addresses you must set them up, but the retrieval of the messages stored locally in the old profile will need a special manipulation which I will explain if necessary. The same manipulation will be necessary if you used the Local Folders for storing messages. in the old profile
creator: Mapenzi

content:
I've done the first two steps and only have the transfer of the Local Folders left to do. Could you explain that? Is it as simple as copying Mail/Local Folders from the profile? (some older posts have suggested that)

Again, thank-you so much for your help with this!
creator: james.d.gifford

content: Thunderbird closed , copy "Local Folders" in "Mail" of the old profile and replace Local folders in Mail of the new profile with the copy. That's all for your messages if you didn't have POP accounts in the old profile. Do you need help for your Thunderbird address books or filters or whatever?
creator: Mapenzi

creator: m.loche

content:
In Thunderbird le impostazioni sono solo quelle che hai citato tu. In PortableApps non saprei.

Esiste inoltre questo metodo per disabilitare completamente gli aggiornamenti: https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=77622.msg537333#msg537333

E' possibile bloccare gli aggiornamenti di Thunderbird a livello di sistema operativo (per tutti gli utenti) creando una regole nel file policies.json. (1) Individuare la cartella che contiene l'eseguibile di Thunderbird (ad esempio thunderbird.exe in Windows) (2) Creare -se non esiste- in questa posizione una cartella denominata distribution (3) All'interno della cartella distribution creare un file di testo di nome "policies.json" (senza apici) (4) Nel file "policies.json" inserire questa porzione di codice { 

 "policies": {

"DisableAppUpdate": true 

 }

} Riavviato Thunderbird, andando in menu > aiuto > informazioni su Thunderbird, nella riga relativa agli aggiornamenti, troveremo la scritta Aggiornamenti disattivati dall'amministratore di sistema.

content:
Marcin Trybura said
Hello, Please help me with the search engine in Thunderbird 128.9.2esr (64 bits). Until now the search engine worked fine. Now when I try to search for a term the search engine shows me results only from October 2024 to March 2005 and I have messages in folders from 2020. In the settings, I have the Message indexing and search box checked. I tried unchecking and restarting the program. I also started Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode. None of these actions solved the problem. When I go into the folders in the account I can normally see all messages from 2020 onwards but the search engine does not search in messages before 2024. what exactly should I do to fix this? Thank you for your help Greetings Marcin

First, rebuild the database and then repeat the search. Also, note that Global Search does not search folders that are excluded from it (under folder context menu, Properties). Second, try Classic Search (Ctrl+Shift+F) to search per account.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database
creator: sfhowes

content: Bardzo dziękuję za odpowiedź i wskazówki. Próbuję właśnie zrobić odbudowanie bazy. Skasowałem plik global-messages-db.sqlite ale niestety indeksowanie wiadomości zatrzymuje się na 1022 z 10670 wiadomości i dalej nie idzie (print screen w załączniku). Ale wyszukiwanie dalej nie działa poprawnie tzn. nie wyszukuje we wszystkich wiadomościach tak jak było do tej pory tylko cały czas od października 2024 do marca 2025. Natomiast bez problemu działa wyszukiwanie klasyczne (Ctrl + Shift + F). Przeszukuje wszystkie foldery i podfoldery i pokazuje poprawnie wyniki od początku założenia konta mailowego.
creator: marcin.trybura

content:
Marcin Trybura said
Thank you very much for your reply and guidance, I am just trying to do a database rebuild. I deleted the global-messages-db.sqlite file but unfortunately the indexing of messages stops at 1022 out of 10670 messages and does not go any further (print screen attached). But the search still does not work properly, i.e. it does not search in all messages as it was before only all the time from October 2024 to March 2025. On the other hand, the classic search (Ctrl + Shift + F) works without any problem. It searches all folders and subfolders and shows the results correctly from the beginning of the creation of the email account.

I don't know why the database rebuild stalls, but I would try rebuilding the folders if possible:

https://kb.mozillazine.org/Compacting_folders#Real_fix

Essentially, the mbox and msf files are deleted, and new ones automatically created on restart. IMAP folders will re-download. After that, try rebuilding the database again.

content:
If desperate, you might try other tools, such as the free 7zip to see if it can untangle it. Or Winrar, which has a repair feature. In the future, consider this approach:

here is the info in brief steps:

BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed and NOT running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
Here are steps:

here is the info in brief steps:

BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed and NOT running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there

This does NOT mean that all IMAP messages are backed up because you may have only headers on PC. Not an issue, since IMAP files auto populate on restores.

content:
Jerry Shaw said
If I up-grade my Thunderbird will I lose my yellow wood grain window or the way it look s now ? See Image below

Best anyone can do is say probably. I "think" that the theme you have is walnut and it has not been supported from quite a number of years since the release of version 68 actually. There is a newer Walnut theme, but is does not do the pane backgrounds. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/walnut-light/?src=search

Why can't I run anything from my Thunderbird window - always get the same graphic image ? See Image Below

Jerry Shaw said
No reply ?

Based on my guesses you are probably running Thunderbird V60 or even an earlier version of the software. You do not say, but post an image that shows a theme that appears to be from the era.

Issues with Hyperlinks, are rarely related to Thunderbird. They almost always result to incorrect Windows settings or antivirus type products that have messed up Thunderbird's ability to access the internet.

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/hyperlinks-in-messages-not-working The majority of the information really only pertains to Linux, but the option is there.

The error dialog you are seeing is trying to open this link https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/updating-thunderbird Try opening the link from the response email, if that does not work, what happens is you right click and explicitly select open link in Browser from the menu. That may of some insight into the cause of your issue. But primarily the supported versions of Thunderbird are 128 and above. I suggest you install a supported version. I have stayed with the more stable ESR version 128 rather than the monthly release 137.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: the IMAP server takes precedence. Messages on PC that are not on server are deleted from PC. IMAP accounts automatically repopulate to the current status. Many users do backups that do not include message folders, knowing they will be repopulated.

content:
What is this concern I keep seeing from folk worried about marking something they are deleting as read. Reading is something you do, not something you advertise. There is no security issue with marking every thing in the folder read.

Perhaps change how long Thunderbird waits to mark messages a read of a longer period instead of immediately if it is truly concerning you, or turn off the reading/Message pane. F8 toggles that setting. mark as read is a user option in settings. I found it after searching for "read" as the image highlights.

content:
Yes you are correct, Windows has limits, which in this case Microsoft is moving to address. But I really do not know what assistance you are seeking in a peer support forum. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/fileio/maximum-file-path-limitation?tabs=registry

I am sure you can find plenty of folk that have written huge folder names in these very forums that hit the windows limit. Perhaps folk should restrain their creative writing to in folder names. This 10 years old but is indicative that is is neither a new issue or one that is not understood. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1093860 Or this related issue with printing with exceedingly long subjects https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1093035

Thunderbird does struggle with these deep structures and issues like your MSF error are usually an obvious pointer that you have probably encountered the windows 260 character limit. In conjunction with this the "copies" made to help the poor old windows search generally have the longest path names of all the they usually mess up first.
creator: MattAuSupport
